sn35.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn35.1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
sn35.1:2.4: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn35.1:2.18: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn35.1:2.19: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.1:2.20: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.1:2.21: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
